channel.title: BBC News - Business
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Return to the office would help young workers, says Rishi Sunak
item.description: The chancellor says being in the office helped him build strong relationships when he started out.

item.title: Greggs to create 500 jobs as it plans 100 more stores
item.description: The bakery chain swings back to profit and says it plans to keep expanding on the High Street.

item.title: Bank fraud: ‘I had £9,000 stolen from my account’
item.description: Scam victims are having difficulties getting bank support after losing cash, consumer group Which? says.

item.title: Covid-19: Amber watchlist travel idea scrapped
item.description: A government source says they have dropped proposals for a new category in the traffic light system.

item.title: Shares slide after China brands online games 'electronic drugs'
item.description: In recent months Beijing has cracked down on China's technology and private education industries.

item.title: Qantas stands down 2,500 staff over Sydney lockdown
item.description: The airline says it expects Australia's largest city to be closed for at least two more months.

item.title: Finance firms plan to close coal plants in Asia
item.description: The Asian Development Bank aims to have the plan ready for the COP26 climate conference in November.

item.title: Twitter works with news sites to tackle disinformation
item.description: Twitter announces it will cooperate with two news agencies to promote more reliable information.

item.title: Goldman Sachs raises banker pay after 95-hour week complaint
item.description: The pay rise comes as top city banker says young recruits should stop moaning about long hours.

item.title: Pingdemic: ‘I'm losing hundreds of pounds in tips’
item.description: An ill-timed alert on the NHS Covid app can mean bar staff losing out on tip income at the weekend.

item.title: Government could intervene in Meggitt takeover
item.description: The UK government is "closely monitoring" a US firm's plan to buy the UK defence and aerospace company.

item.title: Beyond Meat boss: Tax on negative impacts "does appeal"
item.description: Ethan Brown tells the BBC his firm wants to bring down the price of plant-based meat.

item.title: Banking giant HSBC sees first half profit more than double
item.description: The UK-based firm said the jump in profits was driven by an economic rebound in Britain and Hong Kong.

item.title: Afterpay: Jack Dorsey's Square in Australia's biggest buyout
item.description: The $29bn deal for Afterpay will create an instalments payment giant in a hugely growing sector.

item.title: Hollywood plans £700m film and TV studios in Hertfordshire
item.description: Developers say the site could contribute £300m a year to the local economy and create 4,500 jobs.

item.title: Zoom settles US class action privacy lawsuit for $86m
item.description: The video conferencing firm denies wrongdoing, but has agreed to boost security measures.

item.title: Pay rise for Aldi lorry drivers amid shortage
item.description: The supermarket is the latest to offer incentives for drivers after disruption to supply chains.

item.title: Corporate fraud: The dark side of business
item.description: Twenty years on from the collapse of Enron, are the rules preventing corporate fraud tough enough?

item.title: Finding answers to the world's drinking water crisis
item.description: Scientists are racing to come up with technologies that can solve the world's clean water shortage.

item.title: The fungus and bacteria tackling plastic waste
item.description: Bacteria, fungus and enzymes can all digest plastic, but can they work at a useful commercial scale?

item.title: 'My bakery lets you take a bite out of celebs'
item.description: Funny Face Bakery shot to fame when Kris Jenner and Kim Kardashian posted about its cookies.

item.title: Music industry turns to livestreaming to boost revenue
item.description: Festivals, DJs and musicians are all using new tech to entertain fans and make money during Covid.

item.title: My Money: 'I had forgotten how it all adds up'
item.description: Marketeer Toni says being able to socialise more and meet colleagues is pushing her spending higher.

item.title: CEO Secrets: The son who hired his father and sister
item.description: Ross Testa explains why he hired his sister and then his father for his social media business.

item.title: Can better tech make video meetings less excruciating?
item.description: Technology firms are scrambling to add new features but will video calls improve.
